meanings.definition: Illuminate: to light up or brighten
meanings.sent1: The sun illumes the sky every morning.
meanings.sent2: The lamp illumes the room with a warm glow.
meanings.sent3: The fireflies illume the garden like tiny lanterns.
meanings.sent4: Her smile illumes the room brighter than any light.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse illumes the dark sea, guiding ships to safety.

meanings.sent1: The illuminated sign caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The illuminated path led us through the dark forest.
meanings.sent3: The illuminated fountain sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her face looked illuminated with joy.
meanings.sent5: The illuminated city skyline was a breathtaking sight.

meanings.definition: Illumination: the act of lighting up or brightening
meanings.sent1: The illumination of the fireworks lit up the night sky.
meanings.sent2: The streetlights provide illumination for the road at night.
meanings.sent3: The illumination of the disco ball added a fun touch to the party.
meanings.sent4: The illumination of knowledge can brighten one's future.
meanings.sent5: The illumination of the stage made the performance even more magical.
